discovered_types.description: Elements indicating an access challenge, likely a CAPTCHA or JavaScript/cookie check, preventing direct content access.

document_root.purpose: Root element of the HTML document, indicating an interstitial or challenge page due to its text content.
document_root.reasoning: It's the root `<html>` tag. The text 'Just a moment...' and embedded CSS strongly suggest a challenge page (e.g., Cloudflare, bot protection).

page_body.purpose: Main container for all visible content on the page, specifically the challenge message.
page_body.reasoning: It's the `<body>` tag, which holds all the visible content. The contained text 'Enable JavaScript and cookies to continue' confirms its role in presenting the challenge.

challenge_message_container.purpose: Primary content area displaying the message to bypass the challenge.
challenge_message_container.reasoning: This `div` has `role='main'` and `class='main-wrapper'`, explicitly marking it as the main content area. It directly contains the critical instruction 'Enable JavaScript and cookies to continue' for the challenge.
